Title: 2011-2013 Scion tC Mid-Range Door Speaker Replacement

Lines.Text: using plastic pry tool . pry silver cover from handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Using plastic pry tool. Pry silver cover from handle.

Lines.Text: using plastic pry tool . pry control panel off which controls locking , unlocking and windows .

Steps.Text_raw: Using plastic pry tool. Pry Control panel off which controls locking, unlocking and windows.

Lines.Text: un-attach white header ( connector ) from control panel . push side tab on side of white connector if a little stuck .

Steps.Text_raw: Un-attach white header(connector) from control panel. Push side tab on side of white connector if a little stuck.

Lines.Text: using pry tool . pry off plastic plate in section of door lock or pull handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Using pry tool. Pry off plastic plate in section of door lock or pull handle.

Lines.Text: remove the 4 25 mm screw and the 2 25 mm screw on panel with a standard phillips screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the #4 25mm screw and the #2 25mm screw on panel with a standard Phillips Screwdriver.

Lines.Text: pry off full door panel starting at bottom and working up the side , pulling fairly hard waiting . clicking noises are a good sign the door panel is unlocking .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry Off Full Door Panel starting at bottom and working up the side, pulling fairly hard waiting. Clicking noises are a good sign the door panel is unlocking.

Lines.Text: once door panel is free , remember to remove header from the tweeter in upper right hand corner of panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Once door panel is free, remember to remove header from the tweeter in upper right hand corner of panel.

Lines.Text: remove bracket from door by unscrewing the two 14 mm nuts pictured here connected to the speaker unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove bracket from door by unscrewing the two 14 mm nuts pictured here connected to the speaker unit.

Lines.Text: remove speaker from bracket by unscrewing the two 2 12 mm screws using a phillips head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove speaker from bracket by unscrewing the two #2 12mm screws using a Phillips head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: desolder wires to new speaker unit using solder wick or a desoldering tool .
if you don't have experience soldering , make sure to check out soldering guide .
soldering uses high temperatures . be careful not to damage the components or injure yourself in the process .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder wires to new speaker unit using solder wick or a desoldering tool. If you don't have experience soldering, make sure to check out [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|this soldering guide]. Soldering uses high temperatures. Be careful not to damage the components or injure yourself in the process.

Subject: Mid-Range Door Speaker
